column4: On Ubuntu gutsy - I just got a 24 inch widescreen lcd capable of 1920x1200 - everything works perfectly using NV driver, but not nvidia (just installed latest legacy driver) at 1920x1200 - nvidia driver works fine at 1600x1200 (when starting up) but when I start nvidia in 16x12 I can switch to 1920x1200 without issues - any ideas?
so it starts gdm / x fine at 1600x1200, and I can switch from there to 1920x1200 fine, but starting at 1920x1200 doesn't work
is there any way I can change the resolution from command line on a per session basis? like the gnome screen resolution system?
